Steps: 1. Open app â†’ Register. 2. Fill email, password, name, phone. 3. Select Municipality + Barangay. 4. Submit.
Expected Result: Account created; redirected to Login or Account Setup.

Steps: 1. Enter email and password. 2. Click Sign in.
Expected Result: Redirected to Dashboard (or Account Setup if profile incomplete).

Steps: 1. Enter valid email, wrong password. 2. Sign in.
Expected Result: Error message; stay on Login.

Steps: 1. While logged in, open profile/menu. 2. Click Logout.
Expected Result: Redirected to Login; cannot access protected pages.

Steps: 1. Login as user without municipality/barangay. 2. Complete Account Setup: select Municipality, Barangay, submit.
Expected Result: Profile saved; can access dashboard.

Steps: 1. Logout. 2. In browser go to /dashboard (or /incidents, /notifications).
Expected Result: Redirected to Login.

Steps: 1. Login as Resident. 2. Go to Report Incident.
Expected Result: Report form loads; can select type

Steps: 1. Select incident type. 2. Enter description. 3. Ensure location filled. 4. Submit.
Expected Result: Success message; incident appears in View Incidents.

Steps: 1. Fill required fields. 2. Attach at least one photo or video. 3. Submit.
Expected Result: Incident created; media visible in incident details.

Steps: 1. Leave description (or type) empty. 2. Submit.
Expected Result: Validation error; form not submitted.

Steps: 1. Login as resident with barangay/municipality set. 2. Open Report form.
Expected Result: Location section shows or pre-fills user's barangay/municipality.

Steps: 1. User A = Barangay Official. 2. User B = Resident. 3. B reports incident in A's barangay. 4. A on Dashboard or Notifications.
Expected Result: A gets new notification (and sound if role has alerts).

Steps: 1. Login as Barangay Official or MDRRMO. 2. Go to Notifications.
Expected Result: List of notifications; unread clearly marked.

Test Case: Mark as read by viewing incident
Steps: 1. Have unread notification for an incident. 2. Click notification and open that incident. 3. Go back to Notifications.
Expected Result: That notification is now read.

Steps: 1. Tester A on Notifications page. 2. Tester B reports incident for A's scope.
Expected Result: New notification appears on A's list without refresh.

Test Case: Sound plays for coordinator on new incident
Steps: 1. Login as Barangay Official or MDRRMO. 2. Keep Dashboard open. 3. Another user reports incident.
Expected Result: Sound plays when incident is created.

Steps: 1. Login as Resident. 2. Another user reports incident.
Expected Result: No sound alert for resident.

Steps: 1. Get sound alert for an incident. 2. Open that incident.
Expected Result: Sound stops; no repeated sound for same incident.

Steps: 1. Login as Barangay Official. 2. Open Dashboard.
Expected Result: Dashboard loads; stats or incident list visible.

Steps: 1. User A on Dashboard. 2. User B reports new incident.
Expected Result: New incident appears on A's screen without refresh.

Test Case: Barangay sees only own barangay incidents
Steps: 1. Login as Barangay Official. 2. View incidents list.
Expected Result: Only incidents in that official's barangay.

Steps: 1. Login as MDRRMO. 2. View incidents.
Expected Result: Incidents for that municipality (all barangays).

Steps: 1. Login as Municipal Admin. 2. Open dashboard/charts.
Expected Result: Can see data for all barangays in municipality.

Steps: 1. From dashboard or View Incidents, click an incident.
Expected Result: Modal or page shows type

Steps: 1. Login as Barangay Official. 2. Open incident in their barangay. 3. Change status. 4. Save.
Expected Result: Status updates; visible in details and list.

Steps: 1. Login as MDRRMO. 2. Open incident. 3. Change status. 4. Save.
Expected Result: Status updates; reflected everywhere.

Steps: 1. Login as Barangay Official. 2. Open incident. 3. Click Request Municipal Assistance. 4. Confirm.
Expected Result: Success; MDRRMO gets notification.

Steps: 1. Login as Resident. 2. Open any incident.
Expected Result: No button to update status (or disabled).

Steps: 1. Open an incident that has photo/video.
Expected Result: Attached media displayed.

Steps: 1. Login as Barangay Official. 2. Open Dashboard.
Expected Result: Charts or summary for that barangay.

Steps: 1. Login as Municipal Admin. 2. Open Dashboard.
Expected Result: Option to select barangay or see all; charts load.

Steps: 1. Ensure incidents exist in last months. 2. Open dashboard with charts.
Expected Result: Charts show numbers; no crash.

Steps: 1. Login as Super Admin or Municipal Admin. 2. Go to Admin Create User.
Expected Result: Form to create user (email

Steps: 1. Fill email, password. 2. Role = Barangay Official. 3. Select Municipality + Barangay. 4. Submit.
Expected Result: Success; new user can login as Barangay Official.

Steps: 1. Role = MDRRMO. 2. Select Municipality. 3. Submit.
Expected Result: User created; can login as MDRRMO.

Steps: 1. Open Create User. 2. Check Role field.
Expected Result: Options: Super Admin

Steps: 1. Login as Super Admin or Municipal Admin or MDRRMO. 2. Go to Verify Residents.
Expected Result: List of residents with verify/reject.

Steps: 1. Find unverified resident. 2. Click Verify.
Expected Result: Resident marked verified.

Steps: 1. Find pending resident. 2. Click Reject.
Expected Result: Resident marked rejected or pending.

Steps: 1. Login as Super Admin. 2. Go to Admin Sound Alerts.
Expected Result: Page loads; can see/upload sound settings.

Steps: 1. Use upload. 2. Select sound file. 3. Save.
Expected Result: Success; sound used for new alerts.

Steps: 1. Login as Municipal Admin or MDRRMO. 2. Go to Map.
Expected Result: Map page loads; incidents or markers shown.

Steps: 1. Login as Resident or Barangay Official. 2. Check menu.
Expected Result: No Map link or Map forbidden.

Steps: 1. Login. 2. Go to View Incidents.
Expected Result: List of incidents (by role); no crash.

Steps: 1. Click one incident in list.
Expected Result: Details open (modal or page).

Steps: 1. Use status filter. 2. Apply.
Expected Result: List updates to match selected status.
